_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Two ways of acquiring views [mn114:61.2]: There is meaning in giving, sacrifice, and offerings.
There are fruits and results of good and bad deeds.
There are duties to mother and father.
There are ascetics and brahmins who are well attained and practiced, and who describe the afterlife after realizing it with their own insight.
Two ways of reincarnating [mn114:61.2]: Generating rebirth in a hurtful reincarnation
Unskillful qualities grow while skillful qualities decline
Generating rebirth in a pleasing reincarnation
Unskillful qualities decline while skillful qualities grow
Two kinds of sight known by the eye (a c: That which you should not cultivate
Two kinds of sound known by the ear [mn1: That which you should not cultivate
Two kinds of smell known by the nose [mn: That which you should not cultivate
Two kinds of taste known by the tongue [: That which you should not cultivate
Two kinds of touch known by the body [mn: That which you should not cultivate
Two kinds of thought known by the mind [: That which you should not cultivate
Two kinds of robes, almsfood, lodging, v: That which you should not cultivate
